mechanoreception.notes: As soil centipedes, Schendylidae likely rely on mechanoreception for navigating their environment and detecting prey. This is inferred from their lifestyle and the general sensory ecology of geophilomorph centipedes.

chemoreception.notes: Soil centipedes likely use chemoreception to locate prey and mates. This is inferred from their lifestyle.

hygroreception.notes: Soil centipedes are sensitive to moisture gradients. Hygroreception is important for avoiding dessication.

vision.notes: The presence and functionality of eyes are unknown in this family based on the provided context. Vision may be reduced or absent in soil-dwelling centipedes.
